model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Have you thought about taking a chance and doing something creative and more fulfilling full time? Either making movies or interior design, or is their another creative outlet that appeals to you?
I have been working producing horror movies and I really like it!  It is a lot more enjoyable than my day job.  Not sure that interior design is a good fit.  I just am good at painting houses.
The process of making horror movies must be fascinating.  Do you have any interesting stories from the set?
Oh yeah.  One time a makeup artist was applying fake blood all over a scene.  They had this all over their hands.  While they were spreading this blood around they cut a finger pretty bad.  They had no idea they had done this until they went to clean up.
That sounds gross.  By the way, what is movie blood made out of anyway?  Do you know or do you have a favorite blood recipe?
There is some weird chemical mix that I really do not mess with.  It is easy to clean up.  I try to stay away from this part of the movies.  I know what it should look like and that we want to keep everyone safe when using the fake blood.
Chemicals!  Do the actors hate working with it then?  I can imagine they are a pretty high maintenance bunch.  Do they worry about the blood messing with their looks?
Our actors are pretty amateur.  No big name ones so they are really good to work with.  Hey, how about you?  How is your interview practice going?  I am pretty sure you be excellent during it!
I think this discussion is helping me with making small talk, so thanks.  I just have to try and remember who i am and try to sell my good points.
That is a good approach.  I suppose you have been doing research on the company you are interviewing with?  I find it always helps to know the company as best you can for an interview.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Introduction and Job Discussion', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B discuss their day, jobs, and upcoming interview.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Hello there, how was your day? ### Speaker B: It was good, I have a cushy government job and took a nap during work. ### Speaker A: Thats very good I just moved to a new city. ### Speaker B: That's good, do you need someone to paint your house? I'm pretty good at painting. ### Speaker A: I dont need I have two older brother that can help me with it. ### Speaker B: Well, my two kids help and I bet we could finish the job faster. ### Speaker A: I do help my father too in the farm back in the days. ### Speaker B: I helped my father produce horror movies. That's why they are my favorite. ### Speaker A: Oh really tell me what is your hobby. ### Speaker B: Mostly taking naps and painting. You? ### Speaker A: I love driving alot I can drive 1000 miles without taking water. ### Speaker B: I prefer to be the passenger and nap through those 1000 miles. ### Speaker A: Lol you are very funny can you drive? ### Speaker B: I can drive, but I usually let my two kids do the driving.. ### Speaker A: I just got a call from a place where I put in a job application. I have an interview on Monday! Now if I can only find the place...I haven't been out and about much since I've been here. ### Speaker B: That is awesome news, I hope it goes well. Are you normally good at interviews? ### Speaker A: Thanks! In general as long as I keep calm I'm alright at them, though I have had a couple of interviews in the past where they asked me questions I hadn't prepared for and I got very flustered! What about you, are you good at interviews? ### Speaker B: Ah but they do ask questions that they know you can not answer, it is part of the interview. I am normally alright with interviews. ### Speaker A: Yea you're right, they probably want to see how well the candidate can answer unexpected things under pressure. Is your job with the government still going well? I can't remember how long you've worked there now.  ### Speaker B: That is exactly that they are looking for. Just be calm and never panic. Yes still going well. Can you believe I have been there 15 years!' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Hobbies and Job Satisfaction', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker B discusses hobbies, job satisfaction, and aspirations in interior design.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: You'll do great! Don't sweat it too much. Eh, you know I don't love my job, but it pays the bills. I kind of wish I could work in interior design since I like painting. But THAT wouldn't pay the bills. ### Speaker A: Yeah i know that feeling the things we have passion wont help us in terms of money, but producing horror movies i'm sure you love that job, all people love horror movies ### Speaker B: That's not true, haha! My sister hates them! She won't get anywhere near us when my dad is working on a film.  ### Speaker A: I love watching horror movies with those people i would feel a little better as they are more scared than me. Have you worked in big budget hollywood horror movies ### Speaker B: No, my dad is kind of small potatoes. If he hears about a good project, he'll work with it, but he's never been on a major film. It's more of a side hobby than an actual career for him. ### Speaker A: Seems like a good hobby i wish you would grow big to produce movies like the conjuring ### Speaker B: You never know! It's possible if he gets himself attached to a big-budget script. But for now we're content with smaller projects. At least it gives him more free time to fish!' }
``` 

``` Recent Dialogs: 
Speaker A: Have you thought about taking a chance and doing something creative and more fulfilling full time? Either making movies or interior design, or is their another creative outlet that appeals to you? ###Speaker B: I have been working producing horror movies and I really like it! By the way, what is movie blood made out of anyway?  Do you know or do you have a favorite blood recipe? ###Speaker B: There is some weird chemical mix that I really do not mess with.  It is easy to clean up.  I try to stay away from this part of the movies.  I know what it should look like and that we want to keep everyone safe when using the fake blood. ###Speaker A: Chemicals!  Do the actors hate working with it then?  I can imagine they are a pretty high maintenance bunch.  Do they worry about the blood messing with their looks? ###Speaker B: Our actors are pretty amateur.  No big name ones so they are really good to work with.  Hey, how about you?  How is your interview practice going?  I am pretty sure you be excellent during it! ###Speaker A: I think this discussion is helping me with making small talk, so thanks.  I just have to try and remember who i am and try to sell my good points. ###Speaker B: That is a good approach.  I suppose you have been doing research on the company you are interviewing with?  I find it always helps to know the company as best you can for an interview. ###

current_dialogue:
Have you thought about taking a chance and doing something creative and more fulfilling full time? Either making movies or interior design, or is their another creative outlet that appeals to you?
I have been working producing horror movies and I really like it!  It is a lot more enjoyable than my day job.  Not sure that interior design is a good fit.  I just am good at painting houses.
The process of making horror movies must be fascinating.  Do you have any interesting stories from the set?
Oh yeah.  One time a makeup artist was applying fake blood all over a scene.  They had this all over their hands.  While they were spreading this blood around they cut a finger pretty bad.  They had no idea they had done this until they went to clean up.
That sounds gross.  By the way, what is movie blood made out of anyway?  Do you know or do you have a favorite blood recipe?
There is some weird chemical mix that I really do not mess with.  It is easy to clean up.  I try to stay away from this part of the movies.  I know what it should look like and that we want to keep everyone safe when using the fake blood.
Chemicals!  Do the actors hate working with it then?  I can imagine they are a pretty high maintenance bunch.  Do they worry about the blood messing with their looks?
Our actors are pretty amateur.  No big name ones so they are really good to work with.  Hey, how about you?  How is your interview practice going?  I am pretty sure you be excellent during it!
I think this discussion is helping me with making small talk, so thanks.  I just have to try and remember who i am and try to sell my good points.
That is a good approach.  I suppose you have been doing research on the company you are interviewing with?  I find it always helps to know the company as best you can for an interview.

raw_prediction: Yes, doing research on the company you are interviewing with is crucial. It shows your interest and preparedness, which can make a positive impression during the interview. Good job on being proactive in your interview preparation!
prediction:
Brief explanation: The dialogue context involves Speaker A and Speaker B discussing creative careers, horror movies, and preparing for a job interview. The MEMORY provides information about Speaker B's interest in interior design and their experience with horror movies, which were already mentioned in the dialogue. The part about interview tips and practice is relevant, but the MEMORY does not add significantly new or supportive information that hasn't been already provided or inferred from the context. Therefore, the memory doesn't contain extra helpful information required for the response.

Judgement: No
